did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: Ewa Slusarek Papers

repository.label: Location:
repository.corpname: Connecticut Polish American Archives, Elihu Burritt Library, Central Connecticut State University

did.abstract: Ewa Slusarek and her husband Jacek were involved in the Solidarity support movement in the United States after introduction of Martial Law in Poland on December 13, 1981. The Slusarek's established the Solidarity Support Committee of Rhode Island to aid the Solidarity Labor Union organization in Poland. Such support committees were established in several states and also worldwide. There was a call for the establishment of an umbrella organization that would coordinate activities of these support organizations. In 1983 a group of representatives from these organizations met in Buffalo, NY and formed an organization called "Conference of Solidarity Support Committees" (CSSC). The collection includes documentation and activities related to the formation of these organizations, broad correspondence and related legal documents, press releases and clippings.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Ewa Slusarek, b. Kiersznowski was born in Banghor, Scotland in 1948. She has lived in the U.S. since 1957. She received a B.A. in history and political science from the University of Delaware in 1973. Ms. Slusarek worked as a bank auditor and executive and also served as president of Women Center in Providence from 1981 to 1986. Ewa Slusarek founded the Solidarity Support Committee of Rhode Island in 1982 and served as the North American Coordinator for Conference of Solidarity Support Organizations (CSSO) between 1982 and 1989. She was also active in local Polish American organizations such as the Polish National Home in Providence and Polish Sub-Committee of Rhode Island Heritage Commission.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The collection includes records of several non-profit organizations that supported and lobbied for the Polish underground Solidarity movement in addition to personal papers of Ewa Slusarek. Solidarity support organizations operated in the US and Western Europe between 1982 and 1989. Material was donated by Ewa Slusarek who was active in Solidarity International, Solidarity Support Committee of Rhode Island, and worldwide Conference of Solidarity Support Organizations. Material includes: correspondence, press releases, statements, minutes, membership lists, financial records, legal documents, news clippings, and speeches. There are also some records pertaining to Rhode Island Polish American community.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Material in the collection is arranged by various Solidarity support organizations and is kept in chronological order.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Cite as: Ewa Slusarek Papers (CPAA 93-04). Connecticut Polish American Archives , Elihu Burritt Library, Central Connecticut State University, New Britain.

acqinfo.p: Collection was donated to the archives by Ewa Slusarek in 1993.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: For related material see the following collections: Andre B. Blaszczynski Papers (CPAA 87-105) Irene Dubicka Morawska Papers (CPAA 93-03) Ludmil A. Chotkowski Papers (CPAA 90-14) Elizabeth Wasiutynski Papers (CPAA 91-03)

processinfo.p: Processed by Ewa Wolynska and Renata Vickrey.
